content.description:
SPRING FEVER - 5.10c * (35') TR

Climbs the broken face 5' right of After the Fall. Not bad but dirty and fragile compared to its neighbor. Single small cold shut on top as a directional from the cold shut anchors.
content.protection: TR - off of the pair of cold shuts atop After the Fall, using the small directional on top.
content.location: At the far right end of the cliff.

content.description:
RIDDLE ME THIS 5.10c * (55') G

The corner right of the big tree, starting wide and ending with difficulty at the parallel cracks below the 3 bolt anchor. Take a full range of cams.

"The 13th letter of the alphabet is in the ...."
content.location: Corner right of the big tree.

content.description:
GROOVIN' 5.9 * (55') G

The crack 5' left of "Elvis", to the tiny fir tree and bolt anchors (shared with "Riddle Me This"). Good pro and rock.
content.location: Left diagonal crack  in the middle of the cliff.

content.description:
The Final Word 5.9 60' G

Begin behind the big fir tree (left of center of the crag) and climb the slab and broken cracks to the bent fir tree on top. Good climbing up questionable rock, although harder than it looks.
content.location: left of center - begin behind large fir.

content.description:
ELVIS 5.8 * (50') G

The steep cracks on the right of the middle of the face, leading to the 3 bolt anchor over the top. Stay left for good jams (5.7 if exiting far left, 5.9 if you stay center-right at mid point). Big cams are nice.
content.protection: Gear, some big cams are nice

content.description:
AFTER THE FALL 5.11c *** (45') F(4b)

Short but sustained climbing on the dark face at the right end of the crag to the cold shut anchors. A strenuous start, a delicate middle, and a bold finishing sequence make for a tricky onsight!
content.location: Right side of the middle cliff
